mobs.keywords: drow guard house elf black scowling
mobs.long_desc: A black-skinned drow house guard is standing here, scowling.
mobs.desc: He looks very much like an ebony-skinned elf, if elves had such cruel expressions.  He is tall and finely muscled, holding his weapon with the ease of tremendous skill and long use.  His house's sigil is emblazoned on his dark clothes, and he looks ready to rip any intruders into slave chow.

mobs.long_desc: A cruel-looking drow mage paces around the room.
mobs.desc: Robes of maroon and violet swirl around the black-skinned drow, marking him as a mage in the service of his house.  His pale hair hangs in intricate braids showing his ranking, and he smells quite nasty, probably from his spell components.  He is constantly looking around for new victims for his experiments.

mobs.long_desc: A green lizard slowly climbs up the walls, flicking its tongue at you.
mobs.desc: Looking rather like a giant gecko, the lizard is green and scaly.  Its feet have large, sticky pads on them that lets them cling to the walls without falling.  Huge red eyes blink slowly at you as you contemplate it.

mobs.long_desc: A small blob of glowing light hovers near the ground here.
mobs.desc: Looking closely, it becomes obvious that what seems like one blob of light is really made up of many small, brightly colored orbs of light.  Green, blue and red lights swirl around the center in a chaotic dance, beautiful and mysterious.

mobs.long_desc: A pink mushroom slowly moves around the room.
mobs.desc: This strange, pink mushroom actually has humanoid features.  It has stalks where arms and legs should be, and discolored spots for eyes on its cap.  It appears to be tending to the fungus on the walls.

mobs.long_desc: A strange, cow-like creature with six legs grazes on the fungus.
mobs.desc: It looks like a cow, but is purple and has six legs.  Odd.

mobs.long_desc: A black-skinned drow stands here, guarding his city.
mobs.desc: Standing before you is a very muscular, and terribly cruel elf with scars all over his deep ebony skin.  Wearing dark armor and looks like he won't let anyone pass into his city.  A sneer twists his features as he gazes out, as if daring anyone to even try and challenge him--and his experienced pose, firm grip on his weapon and catlike grace suggest that he is well-trained to handle any intruder.

mobs.long_desc: The drow slave master stands here with a cruel expression on his face.
mobs.desc: Red eyes stand out starkly from his black skin as the drow slaver yells at another victim.  His expression suggests that he enjoys whipping and tormenting the city's many slaves, and the jewels of rank on his uniform show that he is very good at his job.  Slaves scatter at his approach with good reason, for the ends of his whip are covered in blood.

mobs.long_desc: A black-skinned drow mage glances lazily around.
mobs.desc: The black-skinned drow mage resembles an elf from the surface lands only superficially.  Cruel eyes and a face perpetually frowning or sneering offset his natural beauty.  His maroon sorcerers' robes are emblazoned with the crest of all seven of the drow Houses, showing that he is in the service of the entire city.  The odd smell of his spell components precedes him wherever he walks.

mobs.long_desc: A beautiful drow female is here, chanting to her foul goddess.
mobs.desc: The perfectly chiseled features of this drow are stunning to behold.  However, her red eyes remind you that she is an innately evil creature.  A ceremonial silver dagger sits in a sheath stained with the heart's blood of countless sacrifices at her side.  She would probably be willing to sacrifice you to her goddess if you bothered her.

mobs.keywords: mage archmage wizard drow dheduu man
mobs.long_desc: An arrogant-looking drow in wizard's robes sneers at you.
mobs.desc: Clad in robes of pure black, the Archmage seems to be in charge of making sure the great pillar in the middle of the cavern lights up.  He is only approached by citizens with great respect.  His finely chiseled features are constantly twisted in an expression of arrogance, as he clearly believes that he is superior to everyone else.  Looking closely, you can see the insignia of House Kar'Shezden embroidered on the fringes of his robe.

mobs.long_desc: A frightened kobold slave cowers here.
mobs.desc: Distant relatives of lizards, kobolds resemble scaly rats with their prominent jaws and long tails.  They are only about three feet tall, though whether this is natural or a result of long years of slavery under cruel masters is difficult to tell.  Lucky to be clad in filthy rags, it looks like it wants to get its task finished.

mobs.long_desc: A filthy goblin slave drools on the ground.
mobs.desc: Yuck!  You can smell this goblin from a mile away.  It looks like it hasn't been free of slime or dirt since its putrid birth.

mobs.long_desc: A strange, tough-looking dwarf lurches around here.
mobs.desc: The duergar, or dark dwarves, are rumored to be many times stronger and more evil than their mountain-dwelling relatives, but this has not stopped them from being enslaved by the drow.  His overdeveloped muscles suggest that he is mostly used by his masters for tough manual labor.

mobs.long_desc: A tough-looking orc mindlessly completes its task.
mobs.desc: This big, brutish cousin to the smaller goblins looks like a prize for any slave master: he is well-muscled and looks like he hasn't got a brain.  He must be the perfect slave.

mobs.long_desc: A lean troll slave lurches around here.
mobs.desc: His naturally green skin seems out of place underground.  Though he is very skinny, he looks very strong.  His slave collar is emblazoned with the symbol of the House that owns him.

mobs.long_desc: A mean-looking ogre watches over the slaves.
mobs.desc: This ogre towers over the smaller slaves.  Though he too wears a collar, he also holds a whip and barks commands at other slaves.  Apparently he is some kind of overseer.  He looks very tough.

mobs.long_desc: An abused human slave cowers here.
mobs.desc: Looking closely at this poor creature's bruised body, it appears that it is actually female.  How a human got down here into the drow city is impossible to guess, but judging from her slave collar, she is never going to get out.

mobs.keywords: prisoner elven elf serin sunfire golden
mobs.long_desc: An elven prisoner is shackled to the wall, barely moving.
mobs.desc: His hair is golden under all the grime, and his features are quite noble. Pain lines cross his face with every breath, and numerous scars bear testament to his will and courage after being held prisoner by his race's worst enemies for untold years.  Though he is thin and weak-looking from lack of food, anyone who could be alive after years of drow torture is surely much stronger than he appears.

mobs.long_desc: A drow prison guard stands here, looking bored.
mobs.desc: Clad in the raiment of House Z'kenian, this slightly bored-looking drow is waiting for his shift to get over.  After all, it is near impossible to escape from the prison, let alone survive the dreadful city above.

mobs.long_desc: A strange, octupus-headed creature is writing at his desk.
mobs.desc: He wears robes of a brilliant maroon, which contrast with the grey-pink skin of his tentacled head.  His eyes spark with intelligence as his mouth-tentacles grasp at the air, searching for tasty brains.  Something like this should just not be allowed to exist.

mobs.long_desc: An unholy maiden tends to the altar of the Spider Queen.
mobs.desc: A feverous glint in this drow female's eyes speaks of her devotion to her foul goddess.  She is constantly checking her altar to make sure it is clean of everything except fresh blood and other offerings.  Perhaps interfering with her devotions is a bad idea.

mobs.long_desc: The drow swordmaster is here, scowling fiercely.
mobs.desc: Lean and muscular, he moves with perfect balance and surprising speed.  His swords seem like a part of his body, moving almost faster than the eye can see. His liquid grace is surpassed only by his cruelty, judging by the expression on his face.  It probably wouldn't be a good idea to mess with him.

mobs.long_desc: An animated golem stands here, guarding his House.
mobs.desc: Silent and immobile unless it senses a threat, the golem guardian was obviously created by magic.  Carved into a roughly humanoid shape, it is grey in color and stands unobtrousively by the walls.  It looks ready to crush invaders.

mobs.long_desc: A drow gracefully practices with his weapons.
mobs.desc: He looks young and strong.  Perhaps one day he will join the guards and soldiers in the main city, but it looks like he still needs a bit of practice, as he occassionally drops his practice sword.

mobs.long_desc: The High Priestess of the Spider Queen is resting here.
mobs.desc: Though the wrinkles on her face suggest that she is very old, even by drow standards, Vilekka Kar'Shezden is in no way frail.  Clad in beautiful garments of black and silver, she is a stuning figure even from a distance.  Up close, her presence is overwhelming.  She is the most powerful being in this city and she knows it.  Messing with her would be an EXTREMELY bad idea.

mobs.keywords: drider half-drow half-spider drow spider creature
mobs.long_desc: A disgusting, half-drow half-spider creature clicks at you.
mobs.desc: The bloated, purplish upper body of a spider is set onto the abdomen and legs of a huge, hairy black spider.  Some terrible magic must have created such a disgusting, unnatural thing.  All traces of drow intelligence and subtlety are gone from this creature, replaced by brute strength and animal cunning.  It looks very threatening.

mobs.long_desc: The drider king sits here, hissing at you.
mobs.desc: Huge and bloated, this disgusting half-drow, half-spider thing prances around on his eight legs, hissing and spitting acid wherever he goes.  The sight of him is almost enough to make you sick.  Such a disgusting thing simply shouldn't be alive.

mobs.long_desc: A very large, black spider scurries around in the shadows.
mobs.desc: About the size of a grown man's foot, the spider is a shiny black color and does not seem intimidated by you at all.  However, it doesn't appear to be very threatening, apart from being every arachnophobe's nightmare.

mobs.long_desc: A tiny creature made entirely of mist growls at you.
mobs.desc: This is surely a relative of the ferocious mist beasts known to inhabit the Blue-Fog Trail south of the forest villege of Mielikki.  However, it looks very young, resembling a puppy rather than a wolf.  Its teeth look very sharp, none-the-less.

mobs.long_desc: A large pillar of stone hangs down from the ceiling.
mobs.desc: This is not a normal stone pillar....  Normal stalactites don't have tentacles!

mobs.long_desc: A guard stands here, blocking the entrance to House Kar'Shezden.
mobs.desc: His smirk clearly states his pride at guarding the illustrious and powerful House Kar'Shezden.  An aura of dark power surrounds him--or is that just arrogance?  His fine raiment and beautiful, dark metal jewelry don't detract from his splendor.  It probably wouldn't be a good idea to mess with him.

mobs.long_desc: An insane-looking drow stands here, brewing nasty potions.
mobs.desc: His face is quite mad.  Though he wears faded purple robes of House Trenkessda, it is doubtful that he bows to anyone's authority but his own.  His insanity is apparent, he looks like he would be quite an opponent in battle.  Anything that handles strong acid with his bare hands must have quite a tolerance for pain.

mobs.long_desc: A black-skinned drow servant silently completes her task.
mobs.desc: Though she is clad in simple garments of black, the servant projects an aura of power.  It is clear that no lesser races serve the powerful House Kar'Shezden, but there seems to be no dishonor is being a servant.

mobs.long_desc: An elite drow soldier patrols his city.
mobs.desc: The look of pride on his face is clearly not faked.  Clad in fine armor and weilding deadly, sharp weapons, the soldier patrols Dheduu on constant watch for outsiders or anyone who catches his eye.  These eyes, which glow red, are hungry for their next victim.

mobs.long_desc: An arrogant drow is here, scowling around himself.
mobs.desc: He looks like an elf, but with dark skin and a palpable air of hostility.  He seems quite out of place - drow usually live in subterranean cities or in areas populated by other evil races, not on the surface in a dwarven city.  He seems quite ready to pick fights.  Maybe it wouldn't be a good idea to mess with him.

objects.ground: A gigantic pillar rises to the top of the cavern, shedding a red light.

extras.text: Though it appears to be a natural fusion of stalagmite and stalactite, this pillar is constantly lit with a pervasive red light.  Lightly carved runes near the middle mark the joining of the two huge stone pillars into one.

The runes are carved in a spidery script, reading: if you are near to the dark I will tell you 'bout the sun you are here, no escape from my visions of the world you will cry all alone but it does not mean a thing to me knowing the song I will sing till the darkness comes to sleep come to me, I will tell 'bout the secret of the sun it's in you, not in me but it does not mean a thing to you the sun is in your eyes the sun is in your ears I hope you see the sun someday in the darkness. Kourrya 2002

objects.ground: A portal glimmers here, pentagrams floating at its top and bottom.

extras.text: It seems like a puddle of water hovering in midair, but light blue pentagrams floating at its top and bottom serve to keep the magic stable. Through the portal itself, you see only another cavern.  Why is this portal here?

objects.ground: A watery portal floats in midair here.

extras.text: Through the portal, you can see the watery outline of a cavern.  What a surprise.

objects.ground: A pole weapon with a blade of dark steel lies here.

extras.text: The blade of this pole weapon--a glaive--is long and shaped somewhat like a can opener.  The pole is made of the same metal as the blade, which appears to be a dark-stained steel.  However, upon closer inspection, the metal actually swirls beneath the surface, as if there were souls trapped inside....

objects.ground: A breastplate made of dark metal rests on the ground.

extras.text: It is very light, for a breastplate.  The metal hardly seems to weigh anything. It is a very strange metal, formed of black and grey swirls that are constantly, if slowly, moving.  Touching a swirl with one's bare hands gives something of a shock, as if you had laid your bare hands against a trapped soul.

objects.ground: A leather slave collar sits here, its owner nowhere in sight.

extras.text: Made of a tough leather, the collar is very resistant to cuts, even by very sharp blades.  A locking mechanism shocks you if you try to loosen with it.

objects.ground: A black whip is coiled here, the ends soaked in blood.

extras.text: Made of a resilient black leather, this whip shows extremely fine craftsmanship.  It is actually nine strips of leather braided together.  The ends are soaked with blood from many different creatures, giving it a sickly sweet smell.

objects.ground: A shining necklace lies in the dirt.

extras.text: It looks as if someone caught a ball of pure light and set it on a fine chain. The form of the ball is constantly changing as it sparkles in different directions.

objects.ground: A black, humming key is lying here, unnoticed.

extras.text: It's a large, black key.  Magical energy keeps it humming.

objects.ground: A double spear of quartz rests serenely on the ground.

extras.text: A large quartz crystal that splits into twin spears, this crystal humms with energy.  The illithid probably imbued it with a portion of his power.

objects.ground: A black spider crawls on a small necklace here.

extras.text: The black stone spider on the end of the necklace chain seems to be alive.  It crawls back and forth on the chain whenever it senses danger.

objects.ground: A spear made of adamant metal is resting here.

extras.text: The spear is made entirely out of the pale adamantine metal that, according to superstition, never goes dull until its bearer is defeated in battle.  It is about six feet long and looks pretty unweildy to someone who has not trained with spears before.  Yet it would be extremely deadly in hands trained to use it properly.

objects.ground: An ethereal-looking black vest shimmers in and out of sight.

extras.text: Woven of an unknown black fabric, this vest slowly fades in and out of existance.  It seems perfectly solid, yet reflects light very well.

objects.ground: A shiny longsword is lying here on the ground.

extras.text: Much lighter than a regular longsword, its versatility and keen edge can probably be attributed to the material it is constructed out of.  The rare metal adamantine is used exclusively in its blade, making this a valuable weapon indeed.

objects.ground: A practice sword rests against the wall.

extras.text: Made of cheap metal, this sword seems to be weighted to make one's arm tired. This is to let the trainees get used to the weight of a sword.  Though it is of inferior craftsmanship, it is well balanced and should work well in simple combat.

objects.ground: A beaten copper sun shines with a brilliant light here.

extras.text: Shaped like a small artist's rendition of the sun, the core is made of a brightly glowing yellow material that is cool to the touch despite the light it sheds.  Extending from the core in four directions are flame-shaped reddish copper rays.  It looks like it would make a fine identifying mark on a cloak.

objects.ground: A bracelet in the shape of a black and silver spider has been left here.

extras.text: Though the spider is made entirely aout of black and silver metal, it crawls around of its own free will.  As soon as it recognizes an owner, it settles back and two of its eight legs extend into a lopp so that it can be worn around the wrist as a bracelet.  Its tiny ruby eyes wink up at you as you contemplate it.

objects.ground: A cloak spun out of shadows and darkness rests here.

extras.text: It feels almost fluffy and very weightless.  It becomes more clearly defined in the light, appearing to be more like black cloth, yet when in the shadows it fades until it is barely visible.  Cloaked in shadow, it would be easy to remain hidden wherever there is darkness.

objects.ground: A key shaped like a black widow spider is lying here.

extras.text: The handle is shaped like the poisonous spider's body, while the legs make up the actual key.  The red hourglass of the black widow feels warm to the touch.

objects.short: the head of the drider king
objects.ground: A severed, bloated drow head is rolling around here.

extras.text: The tortured, insane expression of the drider king remains intact, even in death.

objects.ground: A fresh, steaming heart sits in the corner here.

extras.text: Red and steaming, this fresh heart is thankfully no longer beating.  It definitely came from a human-sized creature.  Yuck.

objects.ground: A purple-capped mushroom pushes its way out of the ground.

extras.text: The broad cap of this brilliant purple mushroom smells rather good.  It doesn't seem to be producing spores yet, so is probably quite delicious.

objects.ground: A bulb of pink fungus grows out of the wall.

extras.text: This bright pink fungus actually smells quite appetizing.  It is not discolored by any bruises or spots--unless, of course, the pink that almost hurts the eyes is a discoloration.

objects.ground: A bowl of stew steams, left on the ground.

extras.text: Chinks of unidentifiable substances float in a thick broth.  Whether or not the rancid stew is edible, is impossible to declare.

objects.ground: A sprig of parsley is sitting here, ready to garnish a dish.

extras.text: A fluffy little herb, parsley is often used to add flavor or color to otherwise unremarkable dishes.

objects.ground: A delicious-smelling packet of spice is sitting here.

extras.text: It's a small linen packet filled with the yummy-smelling herb sage.

objects.ground: A small jar of rosemary lies forgotten here.

extras.text: A small glass jar is filled with rosemary, a pungent herb mostly used in the healing arts to soothe infections.  It also makes food taste better and supposedly makes you healthier if you eat it.

objects.ground: A tiny shoot of thyme grows here.

extras.text: This fragile-looking plant is known as a spell component for powerful enchantments involving time, such as aging or rejuvination spells.  It is also a main component of gravy.

objects.ground: A brown stick of cinnamon sits here, smelling yummy.

extras.text: This long, slender brown object could be mistaken for a twig if it didn't smell so good.  Used to spice up apple cider, cinnamon is a local favorite in many other dishes as well.  Don't eat too much of it though--in high concentrations, it can be quite hot.

objects.ground: A black spice sits here, unused.

extras.text: A very rare spice, black pepper can be sold for a lot of money in areas where it is in high demand.  Kings and queens have sent explorers to their deaths for this spice, so it has something of a nasty reputation.

objects.ground: An ornamental salt shaker sits here.

extras.text: Salt is one of the oldest and simplest spices known to man.  In some ancient lands, soldiers were paid in salt.  It is used to preserve meat and usually makes you very thirsty if you eat too much of it.  It can be distilled from the ocean or mined from the mountains.  Some kinds of salt can be found in deserts, just sitting around.  It is the most common spice.

objects.ground: A clove of garlic sits here.

extras.text: Garlic is said to be able to ward off vampires.  It certainly will ward off your friends if you eat too much of it, as it can cause very bad breath.  It is, however, excellent at curing minor illnesses such as the common cold.

objects.ground: A small stack of basil leaves lies here.

extras.text: Basil is a sweet, mintlike herb that can be ground into a fine spice.  It has no known magical properties, but it goes really well with tomatoes in sauces and other dishes.  The larger leaves can also be added to soup for a weaker flavor.

objects.ground: A small packet of oregano is sitting here.

extras.text: Oregano is a rather mild herb used to add zest to otherwise plain dishes.  It is said to help in restoration spells and help someone with chronic weakness gain strength.  It goes well in tomato sauces with basil and garlic.

objects.ground: A small vial of a yellow spice lies forgotten in the dust.

extras.text: Two tiny, golden yellow stalks are suspended in oil inside this vial.  Saffron is known as the most expensive, hard-to-get spice in the world.  Each saffron plant, which takes two years to mature, only produces two stalks that can be used as a spice.  It is a powerful spell component for earth elemental spells, and it is also a very delicious spice.  Take good care of it.

objects.ground: A sign outlined in &4&bglowing blue flame&0 sits here.

extras.text: A large sign is here, outlined in glowing blue flames! Reading it, it says in common: WARNING Beyond this point is a very DANGEROUS place, full of wicked drow! More importantly, the tiny mist beasts which have made these caverns their home have taken their toll on many a young adventurer. Please, to be safe, be sure that you can defeat a mezzoloth before venturing any further east.  Thank you. -The Ranger Guild of Mielikki

objects.ground: Sleek black leather pants lie here, looking sexy.

extras.text: A pair of pants made out of a black leather so shiny it almost doesn't look like leather at all, this sleek and sexy piece of clothing is at the pinnacle of fashion.  These are the kind of pants that draw attention to themselves! What's more, they look to be tailor-made for a slender, athletic woman, and anyone who could fit in these pants without ripping them along the seams would be astoundingly sexy in them.

objects.ground: A large ring of fire floats in midair here, burning magically.

extras.text: About a foot and a half in diameter, this ring is covered in brilliant flames everywhere except along a bright red leather grip on one side.  A resourceful person could use it as a weapon, though it would be dangerous in the extreme to wield.  Still, the dancing flames are hypnotic...  What is life, next to the beauty of one perfect flame?

objects.ground: A pitch black sheath with a foul odor has been abandoned here.

extras.text: Made from the hide of a Glabrezu demon, this sheath fades into the shadowseasily and radiates power.  It looks like it was made for a two-handed sword or other large blade.  Silver runes set into the sheath glimmer with arcane power, and it looks both sinister and impressive.

objects.ground: A long oval mirror shimmers with ethereal light here.

extras.text: A long oval mirror set horizontal rather than the customary alignment of vertical flashes continuously with images of this plane and others.  Cities past and present vie with images of volcanoes, whirlpools, tornadoes and other places of heavy activity, be it mortal or natural in nature.  The frame is a work of art in itself: the scarlet silk that edges the mirror is embroidered with golden runes of magic and slender outlines of fantastical creatures doing battle.  Its value alone would be worth the price of a soul.

objects.ground: A long wooden instrument resembling a zither is lying here.

extras.text: Nearly two meters long, the koto resembles a zither.  It has thirteen strings, each witha moveable bridge to adjust the pitch to the musician's desired tone. It is played with three picks: one each on the thumb, forefinger, and middle finger and has a thin, almost ghostly quality.  Many of the haunting melodies played on the koto bring with them images of a solitary green island, isolated from the rest of the world but holding its own beauty.

objects.short: a dragon hairpiece made of carved ivory and jade
objects.ground: A miniature dragon made of carved ivory and jade is resting here.

extras.text: Upon closer inspection, this dragon carving reveals a long silver pin that looks like it could be used to style hair in quite a striking manner.  Two dragons, one each of ivory and jade, twirl around each other with artistically elongated bodies and catfish-like whiskers, looking both fierce and wise. Such a hairpiece is surely the height of fashion.

objects.short: a lock of hair which falls over his face
objects.ground: A lock of brown hair is getting dusty here.

extras.text: It shifts from left to right, always covering half the face.  It's a light brown lock of hair, matching seamlessly the hair on the rest of the wearer's head.  It almost, but not always, obscures an eye.  Despite this, it doesn't seem like it impairs vision at all.  What is the purpose of such a strange fashion statement?

objects.short: a wedding ring of silver leaves
objects.ground: A silver ring catches the light.

extras.text: Beautiful and delicate, this priceless ring has a base of some soft green metal which is overlaid with an incredibly realistic display of silver leaves.  Each leaf is different, representing oack, ash, birch, yew, and other trees sacred to those who hold Nature dear to their hearts.  Intertwining around the leaves is a delicate vine, representing the unity of those bound by the rings. Heartbreaking in its purity, it is nevertheless very sturdy and could probably withstand the harshest of conditions.

objects.ground: A pile of brown hair is sitting in the dirt.

extras.text: This fine beard is made of a light brown hair that, when worn, instantly matches itself to the color of the wearer's hair (unless you have auburn hair, and then it turns red).  Complete with connecting sideburns, it is not ridiculously long like a dwarf's nor the short, weak beard of a half-elf.  It is quite masculine.

objects.ground: A plain black dress has been neatly folded here.

extras.text: It looks like it was made for a teenage girl, but this dress is very plain with no ornamentation or embroidery.  The thick cloth it is made of - perhaps linen - reaches down past the knees and looks like it isn't in the best shape. Still, though plain, it serves its purpose well.

objects.ground: A pile of black and white striped fabric sits here.

extras.text: Stretchy and well-made, these tights would look absolutely smashing with the right style of gothic clothing.  What better way to proclaim your indifference to the world than to wear these tights?  The fabric isn't silk, though it is light.  Rather, it's a stretchy material that seems unfamiliar.  Maybe they were made with magic?

objects.ground: A strange-looking green doll is lying here.

extras.text: It's a little green puppy dog!  No, wait, it's not?  Why does it have a zipper? What's that strange grey creature under the zipper?  Why does it looks so insane?  Why is it making me talk really fast and in a high-pitched voice and making me ask all these questions?  I DON'T KNOW!  (A little button on the bottom makes the doll light up if you press it).

objects.ground: The shiny black handle of a dagger lies here.

extras.text: The handle of this stiletto is skillfully made from heavy steel and glazed black ivory from a stag's antlers.  A razor-sharp blade folds out from the handle, about a hand-and-a-half in length.  Although somewhat heavy, the stiletto can be wielded deftly within a sleeve, making an effective assassin's weapon.

objects.short: a wedding ring of silver ice and golden fire
objects.ground: A beautiful ring of silver and gold shines brightly in the dust.

extras.text: This ring is small, yet anything but simple.  At first, it seems like a simple ring of intertwining gold and silver strands lit with an inner fire, but it feels alive, and indeed upon closer inspection it is revealed that the golden bands have the glitter of living flame, flowing like molten flame around the silver bands.  They also glimmer, but with the power of coldest ice.  One would expect these two opposing elements bound together would destroy each other, but instead the flame burns brighter and the ice rests cooler because of the opposition inherent in them.  The binding is tighter than ever, a joyous inclusion of difference.

objects.short: a garland of blue and white flowers
objects.ground: A pretty garland of flowers lies here, getting dirty.

extras.text: It's a sweet-smelling garland woven to be worn on the head, made of hundreds of tiny flowers, their blue and white blossoms winking out of the green mess of stems.  Though it looks like it could fall apart at any moment, it stays together.  Someone must have spent a very long time weaving it!

objects.ground: A tiny silver locket lies here, its chain in a knot.

extras.text: Cast from the finest dwarven silver, this locket is beautifully carved and decorated by wonderfully complex patterns and runes.  A tiny clasp on one side locks the hinge on one side of the locket, enclosing the memories of those who have passed on and become forgotten.  An aura of mourning and remoteness surrounds the locket, flowing from the tiny portrait painted within-the face is neither male nor female, neither old nor young.  Expressionless, the face nevertheless seems to be lonely, crying for remembrance.

objects.ground: A pile of tattered rags lies in a heap here.

extras.text: This pile of rags could be used for clothing, maybe, if one weren't morally opposed to wearing minimal clothing and one could not afford real clothes. Close inspection reveals the greyish-brown rags to be made of silk; it was likely once a very fine garment.  Perhaps it has some magical properties? There is surely no other reason these rags haven't found their way to the rubbish heap yet.

objects.ground: A pile of tattered rags lies in a heap here.

extras.text: These grey-brown rags may have once been proper clothing, but now the silk is so torn and thin that they surely can't provide much protection.  Laces on one end could be used to attach them to a shirt like a pair of sleeves, but anyone with fashion sense would probably rather go without sleeves at all than use these old things.

objects.ground: A black potion is lying here.
A pile of tattered rags lies here in a heap.

extras.text: Barely enough to keep to the standards of decency, this pile of unsightly rags probably used to be part of a fine suit.  Now the silk is grey-brown with age, and tattered and shredded almost beyond recognition.  Why would anyone want to wear this?  It hardly counts as clothing, and it surely can't be very protective.

objects.ground: A pile of tattered rags lies here in a heap.

extras.text: It's a simple length of tattered, worn greyish-brown silk.  It looks like the only thing it would be good for is a belt or sash.  The silk is torn and threadbare, though, so even tying it in a knot might not be a very good idea lest it break.  It looks more like something for the junk pile than a piece of clothing.

objects.ground: A little metallic lizard sits on the ground here.

extras.text: Aww, it's a cute little sculpture shaped like a shocker lizard...  Or is it a cute little shocker lizard that looks like a sculpture?  Its scales are a shiny golden color and it feels like it's charged with static electricity - you could probably shock someone by touching them with the lizard.

objects.ground: A spider's web is piled on the ground.

extras.text: It is surprisingly strong, for something that looks so fragile.  Spider's silk woven into a protective garment has never looked so fashionable!  Even the strongest blows might be turned by wearing this delicate-seeming robe, and it is surely magical.

objects.ground: Breathtakingly intricate black leather boots rest here.

extras.text: This grand pair of customized drow boots appears to have just been completed after many hours and days of labor.  The flawless leather straps glisten with every bit of light that crosses its surface.  The extra cushioning and soft padding along the sole ensure that these boots are not only comfortable, but very protective.

triggers.name: Block_trigger
triggers.commands: msend %actor.name% The guard smacks you in the head and says, 'No'. mechoaround %actor.name% The guard smacks %actor.name% in the head, and says 'No'.

triggers.name: guard-west
triggers.commands: msend %actor% The guard roars at you! mechoaround %actor% The guard roars at %actor.name% and blocks the way.

triggers.name: shroom-attack
triggers.commands: if %arg% /= mushroom set rightobj 1 endif if %arg% /= pink set rightobj 1 endif if %arg% /=purple set rightobj 1 endif if %arg% /= fungus set rightobj 1 endif if %arg% /= bulb set rightobj 1 endif if %arg% /= cap set rightobj 1 endif if %rightobj% ==1 mkill %actor.name% else return 0 endif

triggers.name: collar-shock
triggers.commands: if %actor.level% < 100 odamage %actor% 15 osend %actor% The collar shocks you as you try to remove it! oechoaround %actor% As %actor.name% reaches for a slave collar, %actor.n% suddenly spasms, arms lolling. return 0 endif

triggers.name: shadow-cloaking
triggers.commands: osend %actor.name% You feel secure, cloaked in the shadows. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% slowly fades into the shadows.

triggers.name: serin-greet
triggers.commands: * This is the beginning of the quest to rescue the elven prisoner. if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 0 msend %actor.name% The prisoner looks up at %actor.name% hopefully. msend %actor.name% The prisoner says, 'Can you help me?' elseif %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 1 * then if they have been sent on the quest already, they should have the boots * or at least be reminded of it. msend %actor.name% The prisoner says, 'Ah! Have you brought me the treasures from Templace?' msend %actor.name% 'Please, give them to me! If you forgot what you need to do, you can ask me msend %actor.name% 'for a &7&b[progress]&0 report.' endif endif

triggers.name: Infernal Blade bonus damage
triggers.commands: * * This trigger adds 10% damage as fire damage and 10% damage as unholy damage * if %damage% eval fire_dam %damage% / 10 eval unholy_dam %damage% / 10 eval bonus %fire_dam% + %unholy_dam% oecho &1%self.shortdesc% burns %victim.name% with unholy fire!&0 (&3%bonus%&0) odamage %victim% %fire_dam% fire odamage %victim% %unholy_dam% align endif

triggers.name: help-confirmed
triggers.argument_list: yes yes! ok ok! okay okay! sure sure! help help?
triggers.commands: wait 2 if (%actor.vnum% == -1) && (%actor.align% > 349) if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 0 * Responding to the trigger in 23721...rescuing poor elf boy. mecho The prisoner smiles. say My name is Serin Sunfire.  I was captured... wait 1s emote counts on his fingers, looks a bit puzzled, then shakes his head and continues. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'I was captured from my hometown of Templace by the drow. mecho &0Please, tell me.  Is Templace still the land of peace and beauty?' elseif %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 1 emote smiles brightly at %actor.name% and looks hopeful. mecho %self.name% says, 'Thank you!  Please return to me with the items and I will mecho &0be most grateful.' wait 1s emote pauses a moment. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Oh, and do not bother with the cursed items.  I can tell mecho &0the difference.' wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'If you forget what you need to do, you can ask me for a mecho &0&7&b[progress]&0 report.' wait 3s mecho The prisoner looks apprehensive. wait 1s whisper %actor.name% You should leave here before the guards come! emote relaxes back into a position of pain, though he smiles at you. endif elseif (%actor.vnum% == -1) && (%actor.align% <= 349) msend %actor.name% The prisoner sighs and turns away from you. say I cannot be helped by one such as you. endif

triggers.name: serin-templace
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %actor.vnum% == -1 && %actor.align% > 349 if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 0 * Responding to trigger 23722 in the prisoner quest. * This leads directly to the actual quest trigger. emote looks grief-stricken. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Well, perhaps you can still help me.  My peoples' mecho &0treasures must be in the hands of Templace's conquerors.  If you could return mecho &0to me a &2&bcloak&0, &2&bboots&0 and a &2&bring of the elves&0...' wait 1s emote smiles fiercely. wait 1s say I could finally escape.  Will you do this for me? quest start sunfire_rescue %actor.name% elseif %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 1 emote frowns at %actor.name% stormily. say Then waste my time no more, and begone! mforce %actor.name% north * Oooh, he gets really mad here. quest erase sunfire_quest %actor.name% endif endif

triggers.name: ***UNUSED***
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 1 * Responding to trigger 23723 in the rescue quest. * I figure he'd be able to tell the difference between cursed items * and besides it's harder to get them all individually. * Fairly straightforward... if %speech% ==yes if %actor.align% > 349 quest start sunfire_rescue %actor.name% emote smiles brightly at %actor.name% and looks hopeful. say Thank you! Please return to me with the items and I will be most grateful. emote pauses a moment. say Oh, and do not bother with the cursed items.  I can tell the difference. mecho The prisoner looks apprehensive. whisper %actor.name% You should leave here before the guards come! emote relaxes back into a position of pain, though he smiles at you. endif endif if %speech% ==no emote frowns at %actor.name% stormily. say Then waste my time no more, and begone! mforce %actor.name% north * Oooh, he gets really mad here. endif end endif

triggers.name: boots-receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 1s if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 1 if %object.vnum% == 52008 quest advance sunfire_rescue %actor.name% smile %actor.name% emote slips his feet out of the shackles and wears the boots. say Thank you. wait 1s say And the cloak? Do you have the cloak? Give it to me, please! endif if %object.vnum% == 52024 emote looks at the boots carefully. say These are the cursed boots.  If you have the real ones, please... say These cannot help me at all. say Do you have the real ones? I need them. endif end end

triggers.name: cloak_receive
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 2 if %object.vnum% == 52009 wait 1s quest advance sunfire_rescue %actor.name% emote carefully looks at the cloak. say This is it! Thank you! emote unshackles his arms and wears the cloak on his shoulders. wait 1s say And the ring?  If you have the ring, please give it to me! say Then I can finally escape.... endif if %object.vnum% == 52026 emote runs his hands over the cloak quickly. say This is the cursed cloak! emote looks angry. wait 1s say Well? Do you have the real cloak to give to me? emote taps his foot impatiently. endif end end

triggers.name: ring-receive-complete
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% ==3 if %object.vnum% == 52001 mecho Looking hesitant, the prisoner slowly slides the ring onto his finger. quest advance sunfire_rescue %actor.name% mload obj 23716 mjunk all.elven wait 2s emote vanishes from sight. give %actor.name% badge quest complete sunfire_rescue %actor.name% whisper %actor.name% Thank you for your help!  Please wear this badge as a token of my respect. mecho A voice softly echos goodbye... mpurge serin endif if %object.vnum% == 52018 frown %actor.name% say What kind of cruel trick is this? wait 1s say Well, do you have the real one to give to me? endif end

triggers.name: serin-receive
triggers.commands: * Responding to trigger 23723 after they actually have the items. * This actually advances and ends the quest. set boots %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:boots]% set cloak %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:cloak]% set ring %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:ring]% if %actor.vnum% != -1 return 0 elseif %actor.level% > 99 return 0 wait 1s eyebrow else if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 1 switch %object.vnum% case 52008 if %boots% == 1 return 0 say You have already given me these. else quest variable sunfire_rescue %actor.name% boots 1 wait 2 mjunk %object% smile %actor.name% say Thank you. wait 1s endif break case 52024 * Cursed boots return 0 emote looks at the boots carefully. mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. mecho %self.name% says, 'These are the cursed boots.  If you have the real ones, mecho &0please...  These cannot help me at all.  Do you have the real ones?  I need mecho &0them.' halt break case 52018 return 0 frown %actor.name% mecho %self.name% refuses %object.shortdesc%. say What kind of cruel trick is this? wait 1s say Well, do you have the real one to give to me? halt break * covers the cursed ring... case 52009 if %cloak% == 1 return 0 say You have already given me the cloak. else wait 2 quest variable sunfire_rescue %actor.name% cloak 1 mjunk %object% emote carefully looks at the cloak. say This is it!  Thank you! wait 1s say Then I can finally escape.... endif break case 52026 * Cursed cloak return 0 emote runs his hands over the cloak quickly. say This is the cursed cloak! emote looks angry. msend %actor% shoves %object.shortdesc% back in your face. mechoaround %actor% shoves %object.shortdesc% back in %actor.name%'s face. wait 1s say Well?  Do you have the real cloak to give to me? emote taps his foot impatiently. halt break case 52001 if %ring% == 1 return 0 say You have already given me this ring. else wait 2 mecho Looking at the ring, the prisoner looks overwhelmed with emotion. quest variable sunfire_rescue %actor.name% ring 1 say Escape is so close I can feel it! mjunk %object% * that ought to cover everything... endif break default return 0 say This isnt going to help me! roll done elseif %actor.has_completed[sunfire_rescue]% return 0 say You have already helped me.  I am grateful to you. else return 0 say What are you doing? endif set boots %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:boots]% set cloak %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:cloak]% set ring %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:ring]% eval total %boots% + %cloak% + %ring% if %total% >= 3 wait 2s emote slips his feet out of the shackles and wears the boots. wait 2s emote unshackles his arms and wears the cloak on his shoulders. wait 2s mecho Looking hesitant, the prisoner slowly slides the ring onto his finger. quest advance sunfire_rescue %actor.name% mload obj 23716 mjunk all.elven wait 3s emote vanishes from sight. * The badge reward is level 50, but the players have to be 70 or so * to handle the boots, cloak etc anyway....:) * * Set X to the level of the award - code does not run without it * if %actor.level% < 85 set expcap %actor.level% else set expcap 85 endif set expmod 0 if %expcap% < 9 eval expmod (((%expcap% * %expcap%) + %expcap%) / 2) * 55 elseif %expcap% < 17 eval expmod 440 + ((%expcap% - 8) * 125) elseif %expcap% < 25 eval expmod 1440 + ((%expcap% - 16) * 175) elseif %expcap% < 34 eval expmod 2840 + ((%expcap% - 24) * 225) elseif %expcap% < 49 eval expmod 4640 + ((%expcap% - 32) * 250) elseif %expcap% < 90 eval expmod 8640 + ((%expcap% - 48) * 300) else eval expmod 20940 + ((%expcap% - 89) * 600) endif * * Adjust exp award by class so all classes receive the same proportionate amount * switch %actor.class% case Warrior case Berserker * * 110% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 10)) break case Paladin case Anti-Paladin case Ranger * * 115% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + ((%expmod% * 2) / 15)) break case Sorcerer case Pyromancer case Cryomancer case Illusionist case Bard * * 120% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 5)) break case Necromancer case Monk * * 130% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + ((%expmod% * 2) / 5)) break default set expmod %expmod% done msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 eval setexp (%expmod% * 10) set loop 0 while %loop% < 10 * * Xexp must be replaced by mexp, oexp, or wexp for this code to work * Pick depending on what is running the trigger * mexp %actor% %setexp% eval loop %loop% + 1 done quest complete sunfire_rescue %actor.name% wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% whispers to you, 'Thank you for your help!  Please wear this badge as a token of my respect.' give badge %actor.name% wait 2s mecho A voice softly echos, 'Good-bye...' mpurge serin else wait 1s say Do you have the other treasures of my people? endif endif

triggers.name: vilekka-greet
triggers.commands: * Here we go, the big evil vilekka_stew quest of DEATH!! :) * This is a quest designed for neutral and evil types only. * If good players want a quest, see the sunfire_rescue quest. if %actor.vnum% != -1 || %actor.level% > 99 || %actor.has_completed[vilekka_stew]% halt end wait 1s * If they are coming back with the items she said to fetch... * Starting with the heart of the drow master from Anduin... if %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 1 mecho The High Priestess says, 'Well? Do you have the heart of that traitor?' mecho She looks greedy.  'Give it to me if you do.  You may ask about your &7&b[progress]&0 if you need.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 2 wink %actor.name% say Well?  Continue now or stop? elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 3 * Here we have the second stage, the head of the drider king say Well?  Have you brought me the head of my enemy? mecho The High Priestess licks her lips. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Give it to me.  You may ask about your &7&b[progress]&0 if you need.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 4 grin %actor.name% say Well?  Do you wish to continue now? elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 5 * Now here we have the player supposedly returning with spices and herbs. mecho %self.name% says, 'At last, I can carry out the Spider Queen's orders!  Give me the spices and herbs!  The finest of the realm!  Ask for a reminder of your &7&b[progress]&0 if you need.' else * IE, if they haven't started the quest. if %actor.align% < 349 msend %actor.name% %self.name% looks up at you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% looks up at %actor.name%. mecho She says, 'Welcome to my city!  All who are not followers of the path of good are welcome here.' wait 2s msend %actor.name% She looks closely at you. mechoaround %actor% She looks closely at %actor.name%. mecho %self.name% says, 'In fact, perhaps you can help me.  Yes, I think you can help me perform a great service to the city.' else msend %actor.name% %self.name% sneers at you. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% sneers at %actor.name%. say So, you think you can just wander around my city? mecho %self.name% laughs. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Get out of my sight.  I find your presence annoying.' wait 1s mechoaround %actor% &5Vilekka gestures at %actor.name%, and %actor.n% disappears.&0 mteleport %actor.name% 23793 wait 1 mat 23793 msend %actor.name% &5Vilekka gestures at you, and your vision wavers...&0 * Can't use mat while forcing them to look - they will see the * priestess as she is temporarily in the room due to mat. mat 23793 msend %actor.name% You find yourself back in the temple. endif endif

triggers.name: vilekka-service
triggers.commands: * OK, this is in response to 23750, the beginning of the vilekka_stew quest. * By responding favorably to her, they begin. 23755 is the drow master * head-spawning death trigger. if %actor.vnum% != -1 || %actor.level% > 99 || %actor.has_completed[vilekka_stew]% halt end wait 1s if %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% < 2 if %actor.align% < 349 con %actor.name% emote smiles slowly. say Yes, you can be of great service to my city. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'I am the High Priestess of the Spider Queen, and therefore I rule here.  But there is one who escaped my power...' growl wait 5s say He must be destroyed. wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'I believe he is residing in one of your surface cities.  You should easily be able to recognize any drow up there, but this one...' wait 5s sigh say He is always trying to pick fights. emote grins nastily. wait 2s say Or at least he was when he left here. wait 3s say Bring me his heart!  Then I shall reward you. wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'You may ask about your &7&b[progress]&0 if you need.' set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 0 quest start vilekka_stew %person.name% msend %person% &7&bThe quest has now begun!&0 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done end elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 2 say Well, do you want to continue or stop? elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 3 say You must bring me the head of the drider king. elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 4 say Well, do you want to continue or stop? elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 5 mecho %self.name% says, 'Bring me some spices so that I can make this head and heart palatable.' else say %actor.name%, you puzzle me. end

triggers.name: receive-rewards
triggers.commands: set accepted 0 if %object.vnum% == 23721 * Received the heart set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 1 quest advance vilekka_stew %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 set accepted 1 endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done if %accepted% wait 1s mjunk all.heart say Excellent! wait 1s mecho The High Priestess takes the heart and places it gently on the altar. smirk wait 1s say You have done me and my city a great service!  Do you wish to continue or stop now? tap mecho &7&bAll characters must choose individually.&0 endif end if %object.vnum% == 23720 * Received the head set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 3 quest advance vilekka_stew %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 set accepted 1 if !%person.quest_variable[hell_trident:helltask6]% && %person.quest_stage[hell_trident]% == 1 quest variable hell_trident %person% helltask6 1 msend %person% &5You have successfully assisted %self.name% in service of Lolth!&0 endif endif elseif %person% && %person.vnum% == -1 eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done if %accepted% wait 1s mjunk all.head msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You are quite resourceful!  This is a great benefit to the entire city.' emote places the severed head on the altar, where it lolls around. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'But your work may not yet be finished...  Do you wish to continue, or stop here?' mecho &7&bAll characters must choose individually.&0 endif end set isspice 0 if %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 5 set num %object.vnum% if %num% == 12552 set accepted 1 set isspice 1 end if %num% == 49022 set accepted 1 set isspice 1 end if %num% > 23749 if %num% < 23761 set accepted 1 set isspice 1 end end * Make sure it's valid, and we haven't gotten it yet if %accepted% == 1 && %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:%num%]% == 1 set accepted 0 end if %accepted% == 0 return 0 emote refuses to accept %object.shortdesc%. wait 1s if %isspice% == 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You have already given me %object.shortdesc%.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'What is this?  I need the spices!' end halt end wait 1s eval num_spices 1 + %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:num_spices]% quest variable vilekka_stew %actor.name%  num_spices %num_spices% quest variable vilekka_stew %actor.name%  got_spice:%num% 1 if %num_spices% < 10 mjunk herb * ok, here we have a way for the player to keep track * of the number of spices he/she has given already if %num_spices% == 1 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Very good!  But I still need nine more.' end if %num_spices% == 2 lick msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Eight more....' end if %num_spices% == 3 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Seven more spices, and my stew will be perfect!' end if %num_spices% == 4 emote is starting to look excited. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Six more!' end if %num_spices% == 5 grin msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You're halfway there!  Five more!' end if %num_spices% == 6 emote sniffs the spices carefully. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Yes!  Only four more!' end if %num_spices% == 7 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Three more!  Give them to me!' end if %num_spices% == 8 emote looks very excited now. msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Two more spices!' end if %num_spices% == 9 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'One more!  Give it to me!' * k, I think that's all the spices and stuff * now back to your regularly scheduled quest end end if %num_spices% >=10 cackle msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Most excellent!  Now I may complete the will of my Queen!' wait 1s emote puts all the ingredients for the nasty stew into a small bag. mecho A servant silently enters and bows. emote gives a small bag to the servant. mecho The servant leaves. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Oh yes, your reward....' if %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23760]% == 1 if %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23756]% == 1 * saffron and salt mload obj 23798 if %actor.level% < 60 set expcap %actor.level% else set expcap 60 endif else * Saffron and no salt mload obj 23799 if %actor.level% < 85 set expcap %actor.level% else set expcap 85 endif end else if %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23756]% == 1 * No Saffron and salt mload obj 23796 if %actor.level% < 50 set expcap %actor.level% else set expcap 50 endif else * No Saffron and no salt mload obj 23797 if %actor.level% < 55 set expcap %actor.level% else set expcap 55 endif end end * * Set X to the level of the award - code does not run without it * set expmod 0 if %expcap% < 9 eval expmod (((%expcap% * %expcap%) + %expcap%) / 2) * 55 elseif %expcap% < 17 eval expmod 440 + ((%expcap% - 8) * 125) elseif %expcap% < 25 eval expmod 1440 + ((%expcap% - 16) * 175) elseif %expcap% < 34 eval expmod 2840 + ((%expcap% - 24) * 225) elseif %expcap% < 49 eval expmod 4640 + ((%expcap% - 32) * 250) elseif %expcap% < 90 eval expmod 8640 + ((%expcap% - 48) * 300) else eval expmod 20940 + ((%expcap% - 89) * 600) endif * * Adjust exp award by class so all classes receive the same proportionate amount * switch %actor.class% case Warrior case Berserker * * 110% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 10)) break case Paladin case Anti-Paladin case Ranger * * 115% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + ((%expmod% * 2) / 15)) break case Sorcerer case Pyromancer case Cryomancer case Illusionist case Bard * * 120% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% / 5)) break case Necromancer case Monk * * 130% of standard * eval expmod (%expmod% + (%expmod% * 2) / 5) break default set expmod %expmod% done msend %actor% &3&bYou gain experience!&0 eval setexp (%expmod% * 10) set loop 0 while %loop% < 10 * * Xexp must be replaced by mexp, oexp, or wexp for this code to work * Pick depending on what is running the trigger * mexp %actor% %setexp% eval loop %loop% + 1 done give boots %actor.name% wait 1s smile msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Wear them proudly!' quest complete vilekka_stew %actor.name% end end if %accepted% == 0 return 0 msend %actor% %self.name% haughtily refuses your gift. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% refuses to accept %object.shortdesc% from %actor.name%. wait 1s say No thank you. halt end

triggers.name: vilekka-eeew
triggers.commands: * OK, this is in response to 23752, the returning of the Drider King's * head. (Why is she questioning? Check 23754 part 2..her goddess * is requiring that she eat the head and heart the player returns to her. wait 2 if (%actor.vnum% == -1) && (%actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 5) emote looks shrewdly around the room. wait 2s say It is not that I question the will of my Goddess... wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'But perhaps it can be made easier. wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'The Spider Queen requires of me that I eat this head and this heart.' wait 4s say But she did not say I should eat them plain. emote gets a wicked expression on her face. wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'You!  %actor.name%!  Bring me the ten finest herbs and spices from the realm!  I do not care where you get them from, but make sure they are the finest!' wait 5s say Return them to me and I will surely reward you. wink %actor.name% wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'Ask for a reminder of your &7&b[progress]&0 if you need.' mecho &7&bQuest credit will only be awarded individually&0. end

triggers.name: continue-advancing
triggers.commands: * OK, this is in two parts.  It represents the player wishing to * continue the quest rather than stopping and accepting * a lesser prize.  The first one is after returning the * drow master's heart (the dude from Anduin) and the second * is after returning the drider king's head (who's in * this area).  It follows trigger 23752 parts 1 and 2. wait 2 if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 4 quest advance vilekka_stew %actor.name% msend %actor% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 emote looks pleased. mecho The High Priestess begins chanting to her goddess. wait 2s emote continues to chant... wait 4s emote looks like she just swallowed something very unpleasant. say Disgusting. elseif %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 2 quest advance vilekka_stew %actor.name% msend %actor% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 say Yes, the driders.... shudder wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Driders are ancient enemies of all true drow.  A drider is a half-drow, half-spider abomination.  When a young drow fails the coming of age test that the Spider Queen requires, it is turned into a drider as punishment and exiled from our race.' wait 4s mecho %self.name% says, 'I say "it", but all drow who have ever failed the test have been male.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'Males are weak and inferior.  So they often become driders.' wait 3s sigh say They have lately been harassing Dheduu. wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Bring me the head of their king!  That should discourage them.' cackle wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'You may ask about your &7&b[progress]&0 if you need.' wait 2s emote waves you away.  'Go on.' endif endif

triggers.name: drow-heart-spawn
triggers.commands: * This is for the vilekka_stew quest in the drow city of Dheduu. set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 1 set quest yes endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 1 set quest yes endif if %quest% == yes return 0 mload obj 23721 mecho The drow master's last breath echoes softly as he dies. mecho 'Mother...why...' end

triggers.name: drider-king-death
triggers.commands: * This is for the vilekka_stew quest, stage 2. set person %actor% set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 unset person while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 3 set quest yes endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done elseif %person.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 3 set quest yes endif if %quest% == yes return 0 mecho With a horrible shriek, the drider king's body melts! mload obj 23720 endif

triggers.name: vilekka_stop
triggers.commands: * OK, here we have the other side of trigger 23754 * where the player does not wish to continue the quest at this time * but they can come back later. :) if (%actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 2) && !(%actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:awarded_23718]%) nod wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'It is fine if you do not think you are yet worthy of more service.  Take this as a token of my appreciation.' mload obj 23718 give cloak %actor.name% quest variable vilekka_stew %actor.name% awarded_23718 1 wait 1s emote smiles fiercely. mecho %self.name% says, 'And should you ever wish to continue your service, just return to me.  Say you wish to continue, and I will give you more to do.' elseif (%actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% == 4) && !(%actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:awarded_23717]%) mload obj 23717 grin say I suppose I could let you off, this time... wait 1s say Wear this to show my thanks for your help. give bracelet %actor.name% quest variable vilekka_stew %actor.name% awarded_23717 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'But do return and say that you wish to continue when you are more experienced.' endif

triggers.name: glazed-stiletto-wield
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_variable[quest_items:%self.vnum%]% return 1 osend %actor% You flip out the blade of %self.shortdesc%. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% flips the blade out of %self.shortdesc%. else return 0 osend %actor% You try to wield %self.shortdesc%, but can't figure out how to open it. endif

triggers.name: recall_nymrill
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.align% <= -350 return 1 osend %actor% You quaff a potion and begin to feel a little light-headed... oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% quaffs a black potion of recall. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% disappears in a flash of darkness! if (%actor.class% /= Thief) || (%actor.class% /= Assassin) || (%actor.class% /= Mercenary) || (%actor.class% /= Rogue) oteleport %actor% 49525 elseif (%actor.class% /= Sorcerer) || (%actor.class% /= Cryomancer) || (%actor.class% /= Pyromancer) oteleport %actor% 49522 elseif (%actor.class% /= Necromancer) oteleport %actor% 49514 else oteleport %actor% 49512 endif oforce %actor% look opurge %self% else osend %actor% As you quaff a potion, you get a funny burning sensation in your stomach... return 1 oforce %actor% quaff black-potion-recall endif else return 1 oforce %actor% quaff black-potion-recall endif

triggers.name: sunfire_rescue_status_checker
triggers.commands: wait 2 set boots %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:boots]% set cloak %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:cloak]% set ring %actor.quest_variable[sunfire_rescue:ring]% eval total %boots% + %cloak% + %ring% if %actor.quest_stage[sunfire_rescue]% == 1 say Please find the treasures of my people! if %total% > 0 mecho mecho &0You have retrieved the following treasures: if %boots% mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[52008]%. endif if %cloak% mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[52009]%. endif if %ring% mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[52001]%. endif endif mecho mecho &0You still need to bring me: if %boots% == 0 mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[52008]%. endif if %cloak% == 0 mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[52009]%. endif if %ring% == 0 mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[52001]%. endif elseif %actor.has_completed[sunfire_rescue]% say You have already helped me greatly. endif

triggers.name: vilekka_stew_status_check
triggers.commands: wait 2 set num_spices %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:num_spices]% set spice1 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:12552]% set spice2 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:49022]% set spice3 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23750]% set spice4 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23751]% set spice5 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23752]% set spice6 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23753]% set spice7 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23754]% set spice8 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23755]% set spice9 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23756]% set spice10 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23757]% set spice11 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23758]% set spice12 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23759]% set spice13 %actor.quest_variable[vilekka_stew:got_spice:23760]% if %actor.has_completed[vilekka_stew]% say You have already done me a great service. endif set stage %actor.quest_stage[vilekka_stew]% switch %stage% case 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'Bring me the heart of the drow living in the mecho &0surface city!' break case 2 say Well, do you want to continue or stop? break case 3 say You must bring me the head of the drider king. break case 4 say Well, do you want to continue or stop? break case 5 mecho %self.name% says, 'Bring me some spices so that I can make this head mecho &0and heart palatable.' if %num_spices% > 0 mecho mecho So far you have brought me: if %spice1% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[12552]% endif if %spice2% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[49022]% endif if %spice3% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23750]% endif if %spice4% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23751]% endif if %spice5% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23752]% endif if %spice6% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23753]% endif if %spice7% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23754]% endif if %spice8% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23755]% endif if %spice9% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23756]% endif if %spice10% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23757]% endif if %spice11% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23758]% endif if %spice12% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23759]% endif if %spice13% mecho - %get.obj_shortdesc[23760]% endif endif mecho eval total 10 - %num_spices% mecho Bring me %total% more spices to prepare this stew. break default say You are not performing a service for me. done

rooms.name: The Basement of House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: A chill mist creeps in from the north, causing the walls of this cavernlike area to be clammy to the touch.  A solid-looking door with the crest of House Kar'Shezden lies to the west, though it is covered with spiderwebs.  The only light in this place comes from the glowing fungus that thrives in these damp conditions.  Besides the door to the west, the only exit is north to the stairway.

West.description: A large door covered with spiderwebs leads west.

extras.text: The house crest of Kar'Shezden is a large spider eating a snake.  How nasty.

rooms.name: A Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: This tunnel does not look like it was naturally formed.  The rock is not smoothly textured, like it would be if it were created by water, yet it is not the rough fracture of a crevice.  Instead, it appears as though it was blasted by a large amount of energy.  The rock is melted in some parts, making it look like obsidian or another volcanic rock, yet the tunnel is clearly made of granite.  This strange tunnel continues to the east.

rooms.name: A Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: The strange, blasted corridor conintue offs both east and west here.  Some rough edges that look as if they have met an explosive force are on the roof of the tunnel, while melted, brittle-looking glassy rock covers the sides and floor.  However, no heat that could have caused such a transformation is discernable by placing one's hand on the rock.  The ripples on the floor continue towards the source to the east.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: The passageway bends here, leading both west and north.  The east and south walls consist entirely of the glassy-looking melted rock, suggesting some kind of resistance that the power met when blasting through the rock.  A few glassy shards litter the ground, making a soft crunching noise if stepped on too hard.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: This section of the passageway appears to be little more than a bubble of shiny, melted granite.  The walls are completely smooth, unlike the mixture of smooth and rough that other sections of the tunnel exhibit.  The eastern exit leads toward the source of this rock-melting energy, while the south leads away.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: This was once a large cavern, but a cave-in has blocked much of the eastern and northern parts of the chamber.  A fairly smooth path has been cleared of rubble to the south and west.  This chamber has little of the smooth, melted rock that lines other sections of the passageway.  The few areas present lead south towards the source, along a string of ripples in the stone.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: This is the southern end of a large chamber that apparently met a cave-in sometime in the recent past.  Melted rock shines on the southern end of the chamber, bubbling and rippling in a frozen dance.  There must of been an incredible heat to have caused the stone to melt.  The north provides retreat from this strange tunnel, but to the east lies the source and the answers.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: Continuing down this strange passageway, it becomes obvious that to the south lies the remains of some sort of energy blast.  To the west is a large chamber that appears to have had a cave-in sometime recently.  Bumpy lines within the smooth, glassy surface of the melted rock are ripples leading away from the probable source of the blast to the south.

rooms.name: A Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: The floor of this mostly smooth passageway has been scruffed and cracked, probably by traffic.  This hard substance makes a crunching sound whenever anyone steps on it, and comes off much louder than one would expect - a warning system?  In any case, the source must be very close now, as the ripples coming from the south are much larger than the ones to the north.  The tunnel continues both north and south, following the path of the ripples.

rooms.name: The End of the Blasted Passageway
rooms.description: The west wall of this tunnel is heavily melted.  Veins of lesser rock that once ran through the granite base have melted away completely, forming strange fissures that echo at the slightest sound.  This is almost certainly the source of the blast that opened the tunnel to the north.  The east apears to be a natural cavern, with a strange light shining in from that direction.

rooms.name: A Portal
rooms.description: The only natural cavern in this strange realm of melted stone, this chamber is dominated by the portal on the western side of the cave.  It glows a sickly green color, dimly illuminating the stalagmites that pop up from the floor in front of it.  Whatever caused the blast most likely came from this portal. Retreat lies to the west, or the truly brave could enter the portal.

rooms.name: A Dark Tunnel
rooms.description: The entrance to a long tunnel leading off westward, this small cavern glows brightly from the light of the vibrating greenish portal in the center of the room.  The watery image of a blasted corridor flows through the portal, possibly an escape from this place.  Faint dripping sounds and shuffling noises contribute to the eerie feeling present here, and the trails of spider webs hang down across the walls.

rooms.name: A Dark Tunnel
rooms.description: The dark tunnel continues to both the east and the west.  Strands of spiderweb hang everywhere from the walls, tickling unsuspecting adventurers. The webs seem very thick on the walls to the north, but perhaps it is only because a strange variety of greenish glowing fungus grows on the south wall, faintly emitting light.  Barely audible dripping and hissing noises eminate from every direction.

North.description: Spiderwebs conceal a large crack here.

rooms.name: A Dark Tunnel
rooms.description: A greenish, slightly glowing fungus runs from east to west along the south wall.  The dark stone is cold and damp, and faint spiderwebs hand down to the floor.  The weak odor of the fungus softly blows in from off to the west, and adds to its overpowering presence.  The glow of the portal shines strongly from the west, and the tunnel continues west.

extras.text: The stone is cold and damp if felt, and the fungus grows well in the moist environment.

rooms.name: A Dark Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel continues east-west here, with glowing green fungi on the south wall.  The omnipresent spiderwebs sway slightly to the east, as if from a breeze coming from the west.  This tunnel is certainly deep underground, ruling out any natural air flow through this area.  Very faint tremors can be felt in the walls, and the sound of dripping water grows stronger to the west.

rooms.name: A Dark Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel grows wider here, and the green fungi seems to have taken over the ceiling as well as the south wall.  The mostly dark tunnel to the east leads back to the portal, by means of which it is possible to leave this place. Westward, the tunnel closes into a bare fissure through which leak thousands of spores.  This is probably the origin of the green fungus, though the many colors of fungi peeking through the crack suggests a cavern with many different species of fungi.  It appears to to possible to crawl through.

West.description: A large crack has opened up in the wall here.

rooms.name: A Fungus-filled Cavern
rooms.description: This corner of the cavern seems to be a haven for a small, purple-colored mushroom.  Most of the east wall is covered in purple, though other fungi make an appearance here as well.  The spores from reproducing fungi make it difficult not to sneeze.  Hopefully none of them are poisonous, as it is impossible to avoid their miasma.  The cavern continues to the west and south.

rooms.name: A Fungus-filled Cavern
rooms.description: Fungi of all kinds fill this cavern almost to bursting.  The air is warm and humid, suggesting that some kind of underground hot-spring lies within.  The constant dampness building up in this enclosed environment has allowed this area to become so fertile that mushrooms and slime molds have completely overrun the cave.  Small animals roam around, grazing on the fungus.  The cavern extends to the north, south and west.

East.description: A large crack has opened up in the wall here.

rooms.name: A Fungus-filled Cavern
rooms.description: Small animals scurry between members of many species of fungi here, their droppings providing nutrition for the decomposers.  Mushrooms in almost every possible color grow from walls, floor, and ceiling in this cavern.  The heavy air carries warm, sulfuric humidity and millions of spores.  The cavern continues to the north and the west, where the humidity seems to be wafting in from.

rooms.name: A Fungus-filled Cavern
rooms.description: Different kinds of fungus make the cavern a riot of color, even in the dim light.  The north wall is home to an abundance of green mushrooms that have many bite marks in them from the little animals that scurry around.  The cavern continues to the east and south.

rooms.name: A Fungus-filled Cavern
rooms.description: A tunnel coming from the west leads into this large cavern, which is home to nearly every kind of fungus imaginable.  It is impossible to walk around without stepping on fungi, and millions of spores hang in the moist, warm air. The chatter of small animals comes from all directions, and the cavern itself leads off to the north, south and east.  The tunnel to the west sports cooler, drier air.

rooms.name: A Fungus-filled Cavern
rooms.description: An underground spring wells up from the ground here, though it is almost completely covered by rainbow-colored fungi.  It suffuses the surrounding area with warm humidity and is undoubtedly the reason why so many fungi make this cavern their home.  Small animals scurry about, making a variety of clicking and hissing noises.  The cavern continues to the north and east.

rooms.name: Entrance to Dheduu
rooms.description: This small tunnel leads from the fungus cavern in the east to the huge, dark cavern that is the drow city of Dheduu in the west.  There is no lock on the gate to the city, which is odd considering the paranoid nature of drow. However, there are guards posted at all hours.  A sulfuric smell to the east contrasts sharply with the nasty smell of compressed bodies and singed hair coming from the west.  Perhaps approaching the city isn't the best idea for non-drow.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: The cavern rises to great heights, dwarfing the tunnel to the east. Well-worn paths among the stalagmites appear to serve as roads, for the cavern is densely packed with slaves of all races and their drow masters wherever they are not blocked by the pillars of rock that rise up from the cavern floor.  A row of stalagmites that has an electrical force jumping between them marks the area to the north as a house wall, impassable from here.  The tunnel to the east smells of fungus spores, and the large cavern continues to the west and south.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: The eastern edge of the drow city appears to be the home of the slave market, for the screech of overseers and the wail of slaves drowns out nearly every other sound.  A large wall rises to the east, claiming that part of the cavern for a noble drow house.  Paths lead north, west and south.

rooms.name: Entrance to House Omaric
rooms.description: The grand entrance to the drow house Omaric is a large gate set into dark stone walls, guarded by the finest warriors of the house.  Dancing lights over the main door proclaim that the Omaric drow are dedicated to the Spider Queen, and the strange architecture is completely alien to anything a human could have designed.  South lie the walls of another drow house, and the main cavern continues to the north and west.

East.description: The door is emblazoned with the symbol of House Omaric, which is dancing lights over a field of solid black.
