rooms.name: Entrance to House Ghaldrzed
rooms.description: Seeming to be made more of magic than of substance, the proud drow house of Ghaldrzed has its entrance here.  The main door, to the north, is inscribed with the family crest and looks more like a portal than anything else.  It is guarded by the house's warriors, though the crackling lights that make up the fence would probably discourage visitors more than any guards could.  The main cavern continues east, west and south of here.

North.description: A dagger floating above a pair of manacles is carved on the door of House Ghaldrzed.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: The wide cavern of the drow city stretches out in all four directions, with pillars of rock hanging down and jutting up all over the place.  Softly glowing fungus makes strange patterns on the stalagmites.  The drow and their slaves seem to be rushing around at a frantic pace all the time, too intent on their destinations to notice strangers.  Then again, the chaotic nature of everything here probably makes it seem normal if a stalactite drops down from the ceiling. A huge pillar to the west glows much brighter than the fungus-covered stone formations elsewhere.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: An impressive wall of stalagmites and obsidian make it impossible to travel south.  The main cavern rises to the east, west and north, echoing the babble of the drow city.  The ceiling seems to be the home of strange lizards that crawl upside down.  Strangely enough, some seem to be mounted by drow!  The cavern must reach higher than it seems, as the the lizards look tiny from here.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: A recent cave-in blocks a tunnel leading further off in the norther direction.  Judging by the slave carcasses flattened by the falling rocks, it was quite rapid and unexpected.  East is the magic-and-rock barrier protecting the drow house Ghaldrzed, and the main cavern continues west and south.  The city's babbling voices seem to be a bit quieter here, and few market stalls give it a semblance of order - but not much.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: A huge pillar, stretching all the way from the top of the cavern to the bottom, rises to the south, glowing with a strange light.  The cavern extends in all directions, with drow houses lining the walls and various temporary market stalls scattered randomly about.  Lizards crawl far away on the ceiling and rats scurry underfoot.  In fact, the rats seem to resemble the slaves, hiding from their drow masters or obeying frightfully, afraid every moment of their lives.  The cave expands off in all directions.

rooms.name: In the Middle of the Cavern
rooms.description: A huge pillar, at least twenty feet in diameter, rises out of the smooth rock floor here, lit with a reddish light maintained by the Archmage of Dheduu. Underground, the slow growth of light around the pillar probably serves as the only clock the drow use.  A small pool of water sits at the base of the pillar. This is obviously the center of the city, as roadlike paths extend in all directions.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: A collosal pillar rises to the north, shining reddish light down on the drow city.  Slaves with dead eyes scamper about aimlessly, going in all directions along paths consisting of cleared stalagmites.  Trash litters the ground, making travel quite cumbersome.  The ceiling is covered with gravity-defying lizards climbing over stalactite formations twisted by drow magic.  The chaotic babble of the city would easily grate on one's nerves after prolonged exposure.

rooms.name: The Entrance to House Vlessi
rooms.description: Obsidian walls protect the drow house Vlessi from intruders as well as the ebony-skinned guards standing at attention.  The door to the east is etched with their family symbol, and the house is carved with strange, twisted spirals and broken patterns.  It would surely hurt any surface elf's beauty-loving eyes to see the mess that passes for drow architecture to the Vlessi.  The main cavern lies to the north and west.

East.description: The door bears the mark of a spider crawling into a tunnel, the house symbol of Vlessi.

rooms.name: The Entrance to House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: Giant spiders prowl the high walls of House Kar'Shezden, and several murals depict spiders gruesomly eating members of other races while figures of drow watch in admiration.  This is clearly the center of power for the vile Spider Queen that the city worships.  Guards standing at attention block the doorway, beyond which lies the drow house in control of the underground city.  It's towers are twisted and its ramparts lit with sparkling fire and electric charms.  It is clear why the slaves go out of their way to avoid this place, the aura of dark power is almost sickening.

North.description: The family crest of House Kar'Shezden, a spider eating a snake, is carved on the front door.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: The chaos of slaves and drow makes it difficult to proceed in any direction, but north clearly leads to an important building.  Slaves look in that direction fearfully, some going out of their way to avoid it.  The east, west and south are excellent choices for those wishing to stay clear of the building, but bold individuals may go north.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: To the east, a huge pillar rises from the gloomy cavern, illuminated with a weird reddish glow.  Slaves running small market stalls are often trampled by other groups of larger slaves or drow fighters marching in triangular formations.  Lizards crawling on the ceiling look like they should fall off at any moment, but somehow they don't.  The cavern continues to the north, south and west, or you could approach the pillar to the east.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: Fungi grow rampantly on the stalagmites, and slaves are picking it and eating it.  Obviously there are some varieties that are edible, though some slaves wear gloves as they harvest more brightly colored ones - probably for poisons or spell components.  The cavern contiues to the north, south, east and west.

rooms.name: The Entrance to House Sl'veek
rooms.description: In sharp contrast to House Vlessi in the east, House Sl'veek relies on its tall, blocky bulk to impress visitors, instead of its neighboring house's tortured architecture.  The door to the west bares an inscription of the house's sigil, and is guarded by the finest warriors of Sl'Veek.  The drow must be very paranoid to have guards all over.  The main cavern lies to the north.

West.description: A large climbing lizard twirled around a stalactite is inscribed on the entrance of House Sl'veek.

rooms.name: The Entrance to House Trenkessda
rooms.description: The walls and spires of House Trenkessda seem dwarfed by its neighbor to the north, but it is impressive nonetheless.  Its guards look nervously north every so often, obviously in awe of the Kar'Shezden power, even though they live with it every day.  The house sigil is inscribed on the door, and a steady flow of slaves coming and going from the south insure that the beacon fires on either side of the main door remain lit.  House Kar'Shezden's entrance lies to the east, and the door of Trenkessda is to the west.  The main cavern is south.

West.description: A spider holding a slave collar between its fangs is carved on the entrance to House Trenkessda.

extras.text: Leaping out of basins made of smoky quartz, the purple flames light up the entrance to House Trenkessda quite well.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: Dark granite walls guard a drow house to the west, while its entrance lies north.  Another drow house's entrance is south, and the main cavern is east. The rock formations here seem oddly devoid of the fungi that infest other parts of this cavern, but the reason for this is unclear.  Lizards crawl on the ceiling above and slaves scurry around on the ground.  The cavern opens to the east, and houses can be reached to the north and south.

rooms.name: The Entrance to House Z'kenian
rooms.description: The door to House Z'kenian appears to be made entirely of scorched legbones from a gigantic humanoid.  If giants ever lived in the Underdark, some of them surely met their doom to add to this family's pride.  Instead of regular walls, the Z'kenians instead have a shining red force field guarding their home. They must be very confident in their abilities to maintain such a vulnerable defense, but the charred corpses of slaves who have brushed a little too close attest to its power.  The main cavern lies north, south and east, and the door is to the west.

West.description: A spider with octupus-like tentacles is carved on the door to house Z'kenian.

rooms.name: The Main Cavern of Dheduu
rooms.description: The red force field wall of House Z'kenian to the west borders on the dark stone wall of Sl'veek to the south, though neither can be entered from here. Slaves scuttle about from house to house and out into the main cavern, which lies to the east.  Just north is the door to House Z'kenian.

rooms.name: Inside House Omaric
rooms.description: The obsidian walls reflect the light of magics being worked here almost constantly.  An altar to the Spider Queen is lit with candles and glowing gems, mostly red or purple.  Sparking white light comes from the magic balls on the ceiling that continuously keep this place in a state of illumination.  The tangy smell of fresh death comes from the altar, where a swiftly cooling sacrificial heart slowly oozes black blood.  The only exit lies to the south.

rooms.name: Inside House Omaric
rooms.description: The obsidian walls are bare, giving the inside of House Omaric a naked feel. Sounds reflect strangely off the glassy black volcanic rock, giving the house an eerie feel.  It is most definately reinforced by the black-skinned drow guards that pace the halls endlessly.  The entire house seems subtly wrong in a way that can't be placed.  Surely the architecture would look beautiful in some human noble's house on the surface, perhaps it is the way the doors are slightly narrower at the top, or the way the floor slopes just a little bit that would surely drive someone mad after too long.  The door out of the house is west, and the house continues to the north.

rooms.name: Inside House Vlessi
rooms.description: This room is very quiet, save for the flickering of sickly green flames on the altar against the back wall.  Only drow are allowed in this room, apparently, because the ubiquitous servants are nowhere in sight.  More silent than their own shadows, it seems, are the drow that tend the altar, all female. Perhaps any non-drow should leave to the west.  Immediately.

rooms.name: Inside House Vlessi
rooms.description: Asymmetrical designs and chipped obsidian carvings seem to be the theme of the entrance room to House Vlessi.  An odd smell - like that of blood only richer - lingers, mixing badly with the strong perfume of the drow and the unwashed stench of their servants.  The snarling visage of what is probably the house's leader stares down from the east, daring anyone to pass and promising painful punishment to the weak.  South is a large, ornate staircase, and the exit is to the west.

rooms.name: Inside House Vlessi
rooms.description: A deep black staircase, like everything else in this forsaken city--leads down from the main floor to a basement area.  The sounds of yelps and cruel laughter float up.  To the west is a smaller chamber, and to the north lies the entrance chamber.

rooms.name: Inside House Vlessi
rooms.description: This small chamber is made of a natural, perfect obsidian bubble. Half-decayed corpses near the walls appear to be melted together. Disgustingly enough, the other servants don't even clean them up!  What had the potential to be a beautiful room instead stinks of charred hair and rotten body parts.  The only exit is to the east.

rooms.name: Inside House Ghaldrzed
rooms.description: The acrid smell of dispelled lightning bolts, along with the torturous scent of singed hair add to the horror of this disturbing section of the house. This is obviously a laboratory for the wizards of House Ghaldrzed.  Blasted corpses of many different sizes litter the floor, piled unceremoniously in corners.  Strong magic courses through the room, making even the deceased twitch unnaturally.  Retreat lies to the west.

rooms.name: Inside House Ghaldrzed
rooms.description: Endless tracks in the dirt of the floor hint at heavy traffic in the House Ghaldrzed rooms.  Sobs and wails echo off the heavy stone walls, paying testament to the House's innumerable years as the center of the slave trade in Dheduu.  The walls are carved with the tortured faces of many races being punished by the drow, cowing the hearts of newly captured slaves.  The scent of blood is strong in the air, tinged with the aromatic, spicy scent of incense. The exit is to the south, while the house continues to the east and north.

rooms.name: Inside House Ghaldrzed
rooms.description: The small altar to the Spider Queen lies in this section of the Ghaldrzed household.  Sickly twisted niches made from the bones of slaves, magically deformed, line the walls.  Thick red bloodstains paint the base of a larger, obsidian shrine along the northern part of the house, where countless sacrifices of greed and power have been made.  The air has a tense feel, as if a scream is just fading away.  The main section of the house is to the south.

rooms.name: Inside House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: This room is dedicated to the art of arcane magic.  Irregular illumination comes from the walls, which dance with electric current in varying shades of blue and red.  A small brazier near the back wall burns with a steady indigo flame, sending wafts of a pungent incense through the room.  Arcane symbols manuever merrily on the wall, jumping out of the way of the electric current and clumping together near the ceiling.  This odd room has exits south, to the main entrance hall, and west to another corridor.

rooms.name: Inside House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: Unlike the other houses, Kar'Shezden has no need of slaves from the lesser races.  Only low-ranking drow serve the most powerful family in Dheduu.  The house is almost unnaturally silent, even at its busiest, for drow are not seen or heard unless they wish to be.  The walls of the great entrance room are awash with red and black murals depicting the bloody glory of the drow.  The sneering visage of an elegantly robed drow woman seems to stare from every direction, watching over her house protectively.  Passageways lead north and west, and the exit is to the south.

rooms.name: Inside House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: Interestingly enough, this room is covered with brightly colored tapestries depicting singing and dancing creatures, deep woodlands and alien kingdoms under the sea.  This is completely out of character for the cruel, cave-dwelling drow.  The initial strangeness of seeing such cheerful things in the drow city, however, looking closely it becomes obvious that the tapestries are mangled subtly.  What looked at first like a joyful dance actually has a man slipping a dagger into a fellow dancer's back.  Feasts include pictures of the nobles eating other humanoid figures...  Sickening.  Exits are east to the arcane magic room and south to a large passageway.

rooms.name: Inside House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: This large hallway runs directly from the entrance chamber of the east toward a twisted staircase to the west.  A vaulted ceiling boasts chattering gargoyles and giant spiders spinning magnificent, deadly webs for anything foolish enough to brave the ceiling.  One spider can be seen calmly devouring a shreiking stone gargoyle.  A small door leads north.

rooms.name: A Twisted Staircase in House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: Leading down into the very bowels of the drow city is a black, twisted staircase.  The stairs look uneven, and there are spikes on the handrail.  The agile drow have no problem navigating it, but clumsy slaves from other houses would shriek and fall at every opportunity.  A distant sound, as of chanting, can be heard from the depths below.  You could follow the staircase down, or retreat to the east.

rooms.name: Inside House Sl'veek
rooms.description: House Sl'veek rises to towering heights, with its trained climbing lizards acting in the place of staircases.  Servants and their drow masters alike ride the lizards up the walls and to higher stories, conveniently escaping the packed house below.  This seems strangely lax, compared to the very strict security at most drow houses, but the very heavily muscled guards must deter rulebreakers in a quick and efficient manner.  Dried blood cakes the floor, mixing with the dust quite easily.  The exit is to the east, while the house continues on to the west and south.

rooms.name: Inside House Sl'veek
rooms.description: The southern end of the house appears to be a giant breeding ground for the Sl'veek crawling lizards that scale walls and ceilings without any seeming respect for gravity.  Young lizards are mercilessly crushed under their stronger kin, and only the most tough and brutal survive.  However, the mages then cast docility charms on them.  How odd.  If the docility charms are used, why does it matter that only the toughest survive?  Is it for their strength and endurance?  Are they used in battle, where the charms are broken?  Or are the drow just cruel?  All answers are equally likely.  Exit lies to the north.

rooms.name: Inside House Sl'veek
rooms.description: This section of the Sl'veek house is dedicated to the martial prowess of its warriors.  Weapons, finer and crueller than most found on the surface, line the walls from floor to ceiling.  Huge stone blocks sit in the room for no apparent reason other than to test the blades out on.  Most of the blocks are carved into strange shapes, having various slashing and poking marks in them.  They must be very good with their weapons indeed to give plain rock such a beating. East is the main entrance hall of the house.

rooms.name: Inside House Trenkessda
rooms.description: Spikes poke down from the ceiling of the entrance room of Trenkessda, though most of them are far above a normal human's head. Liquids slowly drip from the spikes, falling in basins set to the sides of the hallway.  Some basins smoke, suggesting acid or strong poison inside, while others are colors ranging from blackish red to an opaque, pale blue.  It would probably be best to leave these basins alone.  Slaves constantly scurry east, where the house's door and exit is, or west towards a noisy room.  Few go south, where a pungent smell is surely not all that deters them.

rooms.name: Inside House Trenkessda
rooms.description: Bottles full of brightly colored liquids cover the walls in this alchemical laboratory, some translucent or opaque and some with floaters in them.  The stench in this room is revolting, and the solid slab of slate that serves as a central table is pocked and discolored.  What could discolor slate?  Devoid of slaves, the lab has an exit to the north which leads back to the entrance of the house.  There is also a dark passageway to the west.

rooms.name: Inside House Trenkessda
rooms.description: This section of House Trenkessda has been converted into a huge, noisy kitchen.  Tantalizing and disgusting smells rise simultaneously from huge metal vats, and slave cooks are constantly overseeing everything.  The chaos is actually pretty well organized, considering the state of the rest of the city. Then again, there aren't any other kitchens to be seen, so it is possible that this House supplies the entire city with food!  Finished food goes east and away from the House, and waste products go south into a dark passageway.

rooms.name: Inside House Trenkessda
rooms.description: This appears to be the waste room for both the kitched to the north and the laboratory to the east.  Strange mixtures of foul odors rise up from the covered holes which lead far down into the soil below.  Old grease and body parts of all races create for interestingly difficult travel in this dump. The house extends off to the north and east.

rooms.name: Inside House Z'kenian
rooms.description: A crackling feeling suffuses the air in House Z'kenian.  There are none of the arcane symbols that grace other houses' walls here.  Instead, there are wall carvings of cruel-looking drow and strange, octupus-headed creatures. Slaves hardly make any noise, and their masters can be seen strutting arrogantly throughout the halls.  East will leave this strange House, or you could venture deeper to the west or south.

rooms.name: Inside House Z'kenian
rooms.description: The walls of this room were obviously once carved with wonderful, yet strange patterns.  However, they are now all overgrown with fungi of many colors.  Some mushrooms seem to be swaying on their own, but most grow at a frightening speed, carpeting the wall in an eerie pattern of their own.  There are exits to the north and west.

rooms.name: Inside House Z'kenian
rooms.description: This room looks like some kind of council room.  Seven chairs are arranged around a heavy-looking slab of a table, and the walls are hung with maps and posters written in the drow language.  Spread on the table is a map that, upon closer examination, seems to be of the blasted passageway that led to the portal into this city!  It is clear that House Z'kenian is deeply involved in connecting the drow city with the outside world.  The entrance room is back to the east, and the house continues to the south.

rooms.name: Inside House Z'kenian
rooms.description: This room is covered in books.  Though primarily in the drow language, there are also texts in a blocky, irregular script that doesn't seem familiar at all. In the veritable maze of bookshelves, there are exits to the north and east. North appears to be some kind of council room, and east is a room populated entirely by fungus.

Down.description: The shelves close to the ground are filled with books of torture and imprisonment.

rooms.name: The Prison Under House Z'kenian
rooms.description: This large section of the jail appears to be where the drow torture their prisoners.  Exotic implements line the walls, some so strange that their use cannot be immediately discerned.  Most are covered with blood and look very unsanitary.  A smoky fire burns in an alcove in the wall, undoubtedly for heating many of the iron torture devices.  The room has a horrible aura of evil.  The rest of the jail is to the south.

rooms.name: The Prison Under House Z'kenian
rooms.description: A foul odor persists in this jail, the smell of centuries of decay and filth.  Drow prisoners are considered worse than slaves, so the conditions are somewhat worse than the worst human jail could ever be.  Not even the most persistent fungus grows here, so there must be quite a lot of toxins.  This place is incredibly disgusting, and the bars to the east mock any prisoners unlucky enough to be confined here.

rooms.name: The Prison Under House Z'kenian
rooms.description: Dank and smelly, it seems like it has been years since anyone cleaned out this foul place.  There aren't even any rats to keep prisoners company.  The floor isn't stone, like the rest of the jail, but rather a sticky, gooey muck that that never seems to harden.  Shackles line the walls, most of them decaying.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Z'kenian
rooms.description: A large gate dominates the western wall of the cavern.  Foul fumes reek through it, and the bars on the small window indicate that it is a jail gate. The silence seems to echo, so whatever's in there isn't too lively.  The cavern continues to the east and south, or there is the door to the west....

rooms.name: The Basement of House Z'kenian
rooms.description: This section of the large cavern is rather nondescript.  Tiny stalactites, no larger than a finger, poke down from the ceiling.  Their corresponding stalagmites are no more than bumps on the floor.  The silence is creepy, with the air containing a palpable aura of power.  South leads back to the staircase, and west is a large gate set in the cavern wall.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Z'kenian
rooms.description: A huge pillar rises from the floor to the ceiling, with water gently cascading down it into a pool at the bottom.  It's very relaxing to watch, even though nasty bits of flesh and bone float in the pool.  To the north, there is a large gate with bars on it.  It's probably some kind of jail.  East is more of the cavern.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Z'kenian
rooms.description: This large, smelly cavern echoes with the sounds of dripping water and irregular clicking noises.  It seems much more natural than the hewn staircase to the south or the rest of the House.  A smaller cavern sits to the west, while the large cavern continues north and east.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Z'kenian
rooms.description: A large wooden desk sits in the middle of the room.  This is rather unusual, as there is no wood to be seen anywhere else in the city.  A comfortable-looking chair sits behind the desk, which is covered in papers written in the strange, blocky text that can be found in the library above. No paitnings or other ornaments can be found on the walls, suggesting that whoever works at this desk leads a rather spartan lifestyle.

extras.text: Written in a blocky, alien script, these papers are neatly scattered, as if someone wanted to give the appearence of a mess but still wanted to be able to find information quickly.

rooms.name: The Hidden Staircase Under House Z'kenian
rooms.description: The staircase behind the bookshelf winds down through the solid stone underneath House Z'kenian.  It is very dark, and though sounds of water dripping echo all around, it is not damp.  It looks like the narrow staircase exits into a much larger room at the bottom, after a short hallway heading north.

Up.description: The backside of a bookshelf is at the top of the stairs.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Vlessi
rooms.description: The passageway takes a sharp turn here, heading both east and south.  East is back to the staircase and south is a noisy ruckus of some kind.  The walls of the passageway are carved with abstract images of sharp angles, but parts of it are overgrown with a dark red fungus.  The air is slightly drier here than in the main cavern.

rooms.name: The Staircase Under House Vlessi
rooms.description: The black staircase leads down to a hallway that has been carved directly from the stone.  Intricate patterns dance in the dim light, confusing and mesmerizing.  Most are abstract, but a few clearly represent drow weilding sharp pointy objects and poking them into non-drow.  The staircase leads back up to the main section of House Vlessi, and the hallway continues to the west. Sounds of battle can be heard in the distance.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Vlessi
rooms.description: The darkly carved passageway extends both north and south.  There aren't any servants or slaves running around, certainly all scared off by the loud noises and occassional shrieks of pain coming from the south.  However, there are tiny spiders crawling across the carvings, hunting tiny bugs.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Vlessi
rooms.description: The passageway widens to a great training hall.  Drow trainees practice their tactical routines in formations stretching across the hall.  They use wooden weapons instead of the frightfully sharp blades their more mature counterparts are using up in the main cavern.  The quickly cooling corpse of a former target in the corner attests to their ferocity even so.  Other live slave targets quiver in abject terror as they wait their turn to be beaten upon by the cruel trainees.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Vlessi
rooms.description: The training hall to the north narrows back into a passageway here.  South is a little room with a lot of weapons and another passageway opens up to the east.  The walls are carved with more of the same disturbing, abstract images that were near the staircase.  The corners near the ceiling are covered in cobwebs, which is not really a surprise considering this city's worship of spiders.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Vlessi
rooms.description: This appears to be a weapon storage room.  Stacks of wooden practice weapons complete with extremely deadly-looking swords, daggers, and polearms of yellowish and dark black metals lie all about.  Moving around is quite difficult, as any clumsiness is bound to knock over piles of weapons or land on them, a quick means to great injury.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Vlessi
rooms.description: The stone walls of this passageway are caked with red fungus.  East leads to a small chamber, and west leads back to the meeting of passageways.  Small bottles of water line the hallway to refresh tired trainees, and little trays of delicacies sit on shelves, ready to refuel young drow exhausted from hours of hard training.

rooms.name: The Drider King's Lair
rooms.description: Cleaner than most of the other parts of this cave, it is nonetheless very difficult to see because of all the webs covering the walls and reaching from stalactite to stalactite.  Lumps decorate the floor - probably the bodies of the driders' latest victims, ready to be drained and devoured.  The webs are passable to the south and east.

rooms.name: The Drider Cavern
rooms.description: Webs choke the cavern, barely allowing for passage.  It is nearly impossible to see with all the sticky, white webs trying to catch the clothes and armor of unwary travellers.  Bones line the floor, some crushed into tiny fragments from the force of the drider warriors.  It is possible to move through the webs east, south and west.

rooms.name: The Drider Cavern
rooms.description: Pools of strangely colored liquid dot the floor in places here, eating at the webs.  Most likely venom, it would be a bad idea to step in them!  The webs cover whatever walls there might be to this cavern, and the faint hissing sound that driders make is always audible.  Or is that the pools slowly eating away at the rock?  Though they hang everywhere, obscuring most vision, the webs are clear enough to pass to the south and west.

rooms.name: The Drider Cavern
rooms.description: Sticky, bad-smelling spiderwebs threaten to engulf everything in this cavern.  Only faint sounds can be heard through the tangle of white webs that dominate this place, and bits of former victims are still stuck in many webs. The driders have certainly made themselves at home here.  The webs are passable to the north and east.

rooms.name: The Drider Cavern
rooms.description: Spiderwebs choke this area, which is probably a cavern.  It is impossible to tell however, because what appear to be walls are perhaps just webs.  They obscure vision and impair hearing, at the same time hide the driders that made them entirely too well.  Several large holes in the webs allow travel to the north, east and west.

South.description: A crack is visible in the walls underneath the webs here.

rooms.name: The Drider Cavern
rooms.description: Thickly lining the walls and stretching out from rock formations to join one another, the webs are almost artistic to behold.  That is, if one ignores the bits and pieces of former victims that are still stuck in them.  Is it possible that the hideous mutation that turns drow into drider awakens an artistic talent, or is it just that the chaotic nature of a beast results in forms that are occassionally pleasing to the eye?  Probably the latter.  The webs are passable to the north and west.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Vlessi
rooms.description: This is the innermost room of House Vlessi and the home of the house's greatest swordsman.  Broken weapons line the walls, taken from his enemies before they were slaughtered.  The floor is a thick, slightly springy mat that must be great for practicing routines without ruining one's feet.  Apart from the gleam of the weapons, the room is cloaked in black.  Exit is to the west.

rooms.name: Before the Altar of the High Priestess
rooms.description: The massive shrine to the evil might of the twisted Spider Queen is here, tended by the city's most loyal drow.  In contrast to the rest of the temple, the walls are completely bare, drawing attention to the altar.  There, fresh blood of sacrificed infidels is constantly steaming from collecting bowls. Tending to the altar are very arrogant-looking drow females who are all subserviant to the head of House Kar'Shezden.  The aura of absolute corruption and depravity is overwhelming.  The only exit is to the south.

rooms.name: Entering the Temple of the Spider Queen
rooms.description: The ceiling of this underground temple stretches high above your head, making the chanting sound echo strangely.  A pervasive feeling of evil resonates between the walls of this place, chilling everything slightly.  Huge spiders crawl on the ceiling, spinning webs and destroying old ones in a constant cycle.  Faint lights dance, as if of their own free will, illuminating grandiose and disturbing carvings of tortured shapes scattered everywhere. The temple continues to the east, and retreat is to the south.

rooms.name: The Temple of the Spider Queen
rooms.description: The temple curves here, with wide stairs leading north to an illuminated altar.  Exquisitely carved arches throb with images of abject horror, graced by giant spiders and their webs.  Irregularly flashing lights rest on some of the more gruesome carvings, bringing light to images that should be left in the dark.  The sound of chanting swells in from the north, and the temple also continues to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Temple of the Spider Queen
rooms.description: The ceiling of the temple echoes with clicks and hisses that blend in with the chanting for an overall effect of total chaos.  The pale spiderwebs are lit by dancing lights of cool colors, making it almost impossible to tell which are occupied by huge spiders and which are only there for decoration.  Ornate carvings of exotic drow line every bare inch of the temple's walls, columns and ceiling.  To the south is a small alcove that seems to pulse with power, and the temple also continues to the west.

rooms.name: The Basement of House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: All fungus has been stripped from the walls of this room.  Instead, they are covered with very intricate carvings of drow and spider-like figures interacting.  Just off to the north are bright colors and a disturbing chanting sound, and south leads back to the staircase.

extras.text: A quick glance at the carvings shows a pack of drow riding a gargantuan spider into a forest, leaving complete destruction in their wake.  Just below, in a larger section, the drow and spiders can be seen standing together in a circle while a half-formed demon rises out of the smoke.  All of the carvings are extremely well polished.

rooms.name: An Alcove in the Temple of the Spider Queen
rooms.description: Almost seeming like a random bubble in the expansive temple, this niche is set with hundreds of jewels in the colors of the Spider Queen.  Dark garnets and amethysts circle mosaic-like patterns of jet, obsidian crystals and rare black diamonds.  In the center is the pattern of a black widow spider, with the red hourglass shape made of rubies and the rest of the spider encrusted with black diamonds.  This hoard of jewels could easily sell for a small fortune, but who in their right mind would try to steal from the heart of the Spider Queen's power?  The only exit is back north to the main temple.

rooms.name: The Servants' Quarters Under House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: Even more crowded with clutter than the room to the south, this is clearly where the servants rest and live when not directly serving House Kar'Shezden. The organization borders on disasterous, even though they try to keep it neat. Tiny spiders scurry everywhere, munching on dead bugs or hunting bed lice. The stuffiness of the atmosphere is almost too much to bear.  All issues aside, it is a horrible place to have to live.

rooms.name: The Servants' Quarters Under House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: This appears to be the servants' quarters.  Soft-looking nests of dark fabric lay on the ground, probably serving as beds to the low-ranking drow. Several tables with various tools are scattered around the room as well.  Each nest-bed has a small box next to it, probably holding each servant's personal belongings.  However, they appear to be trapped quite well, judging by the masses of dead insects - though never spiders - that are gathered around each box.  Spiderwebs cover the corners, but the tidiness of the slaves does not prompt them to get rid of these webs.  A large door leading to the staircase is east, and the servants' quarters continue to the north.

rooms.name: A Twisted Staircase in House Kar'Shezden
rooms.description: At the bottom of the staircase is a special spiky area, narrow enough for drow to jump over but wide enough that someone falling would land on it.  The stairs lead up back to the main floor of House Kar'Shezden.  There is a small, natural cavern area to the south and a bright, well-decorated area to the north.  Strange chanting is coming from that direction.
